intro: Monadenium fwambense, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic to mammals. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and has small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a rough texture, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Monadenium fwambense is adapted to withstand drought conditions and plays a role in local ecosystems.
